conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: good afternoon what brings you in today

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: hi doctor for the past few weeks i've been having runny and stuffy nose itchy and watery eyes and sneezing a lot it has been worse when i go outside

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i see do you have any known allergies

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: well i've always had hay fever in the spring and fall but this year it seems to be worse

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: have you noticed any patterns are these symptoms worse at any particular time of the day or in a particular location

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: it seems to be worse in the morning and lie on your plants with flowers

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: have you been using any medications so far

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i've been using over the counter antihistamines but they aren't helping much

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: thank you for the information let's conduct a physical examination mainly focusing on your nasal passage and eyes thank you for your patience based on your symptoms and the examination it seems like your allergic granitis is acting up this is consistent with your history of hay fever

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: is there anything i can do to help this

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: yes there are several options i would recommend a prescription a corticosteroid nasal spray and allergy eye drops also try to limit your exposure to allergens

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i also recommend that you come in for a follow-up visit in weeks to assess your symptoms if they're not improving we might need to consider allergy shots

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: sounds good i'll do that no you usually don't
